definitions.definition: An elongated depression cast between hills or mountains , often with a river flowing through it.
examples: The Indus River valley was the site of an ancient civilization.

definitions.definition: An area which drains itself into a river .
Any structure resembling one, e.g. the interior angle formed by the intersection of two sloping roof planes .

main_definition: An elongated depression cast between hills or mountains , often with a river flowing through it.
secondary_definitions: An area which drains itself into a river .
Any structure resembling one, e.g. the interior angle formed by the intersection of two sloping roof planes .
